content.body: The middle ground between Caridy's and Jack's positions is to use `new Module(source, handler, thisArg/context)`, rather than mixing the handler and the thisArg in the same parameter. This also feels cleaner, since we have a clearly separation between "an object with clearly defined properties" and "something that the user can use as they wish"
(I propose it as a middle ground to not mention the referrer while still reusing the same handler object every time, but it also happens to be my favourite design)
If we go that way, my bikeshed on top of that would be to pass context as an argument rather than `this`.
